resources.string:
1. All rounds of onsite events will be held at the symposium venue. A QR based validation is used to validate participants.

 2. App can be downloaded in campus as well.

 3. It is recommended you take the prelims on the app,although it can also be on paper.

 4. It is not necessary that every team member should be from the same college.

 5. If timings clash don’t worry, we always have many different sets of questions and you can attend the tests appropriately.

 6. Feel free to drop in suggestions or questions at interrupt2k15@gmail.com

The Association of Computer Technologists take great pride in conducting PRAYATNA, our annual national level inter-college technical festival. PRAYATNA, a conglomeration of the brightest minds in India, is hosted by the Department of Computer Technology, Anna University, MIT Campus. Over 3000 students from over 150 colleges flock to take part in this festival. In a nutshell, PRAYATNA is a platform that churns out technical and creative ideas from upcoming engineers by assessing their aptitude in coding, design, entrepreneurial skills and other multi-faceted concepts. Special workshops with the help of experts from the industry enhance the participant’s knowledge and creative potentials.

‘Boisterous’-One word that describes Interrupt’14 best. As always, the symposium
had surpassed the expectations and set the bar really high making it even more
challenging for the subsequent years to come. There were multiple online and offline
events covering both the technical and non-technical side. The workshop on web
development helped the students explore this wide arena. Numbers say a lot more
than words. So, seeing how there were about 1500 students who participated from
across the country, this event was a huge success.

Why not app? According to recent statistics, about 68% of smartphone owners use apps more than
ten times a day and we’re all one among them. Driven by technology, we wanted to make it easier
and more accessible with just a click of a button. Get notified on the latest event updates and
register directly using the app. On registering, a QR code would be generated for the participants
which would be scanned onsite for confirmation of participation. Pretty fancy, isn’t it?

Kindly register yourselves using the app. Upon registering, a QR code would be generated for the
particular participant. Bring your phone along and get the QR code scanned onsite at SVCE on the
day of the symposium to confirm your participation.

string-array.name: debugging
string-array.item: To err is to human and to fix them is a genius. This here is a battle for the bug squashers out there! Oh, and the best “compiler” gets an Internship at Zoho! Get your guns ready! We are at war, people!

An event which tests the \'Tester\' in every programmer. Involves testing, debugging and code fixing for various algorithms and open source application source codes. • Round 1 : An online round testing basics of C/C++ syntax, working, understanding. • Round 2 : Debugging and predicting outputs of difficult code snippets. • Finals : A hands on session, given an improperly working open source application source code, FIX IT ! Maximum 2 members in a team.
For more details:

string-array.name: reversecoding

item.p: Who cares about order, the usual rules, when you have chaos and confusions? This event is all about that and to see if you don’t succumb to it. And in the mean time, restore the order while at it. As evolution has taught us, explosions always lead to discipline. You know what they say, think out of the box!

string-array.item: It involves a series of technical enigmata involving testing your skills in debugging, code obfuscation, reverse engineering and deciphering. o Prelims : Data structures, C basics. o Round 2 : Jumbled code + code obfuscation o Finals : Online Judge based Reverse engineering coding. Maximum 2 members in a team.

string-array.name: webdesign
string-array.item: For once, you to get to be the spinner instead of being trapped by one! Take out your yarn and forge the perfect module that will make even spiders jealous! Come if you are a master of creation and make your contribution to the World Wide Web.

An event for web developers and designers alike. o Round 1 : HTML + WWW + Web Service + CSS basics o Finals : Hands on web and UI design for a given scenario using web technologies. Maximum 2 members in a team.

string-array.name: cwj
string-array.item: Do you wake up everyday with Java on your side? Does it intoxicate you and make you alive? This event is for you Java hoarders and here’s your chance to prove just how much of this language you have absorbed and inhaled.

An event purely meant to test the JAVA programming abilities. o Round 1 : Writing Java code snippets, knowledge of JRE, JVM. o Finals : Hands on JAVA coding, develop Apps with UI, solve hard problems using JAVA. Maximum 2 members in a team.

string-array.name: paperpresentation
string-array.item: Time to let your thoughts flow! Bring forth your ideas and win the prizes! And meanwhile lets see how innovative you are. Open up your mind and share with us your notions! May the best concept win!

1) Abstract must be sent by

 2) Maximum 3 members per team.

 3) Please adhere to the topic chosen strictly.

 4) Choose topics only from the list given below:

string-array.name: ospc
string-array.item: There are no good programs, only great programmers! And if you are one, this one’s made out just for you! Impress us, or rather the judges, with your logic and take home a Chronus internship! All you have to do is code, code and CODE!

Its an acid test of algorithmic skills and knowledge of data structures. Similar to ACM-ICPC competitive programming contest. o Prelims : Tests proficiency in data structures and algorithms, writing code snippets. o Finals : Online Judge based competitive programming contest. Maximum 3 members in a team.

string-array.name: select
string-array.item: The world is one big data problem. If you agree, you are invited to play with data and transactions, and with a reward. Thrill us with your query magic and the world shall watch in awe. Watch out for those deadlocks though!

An event to test the SQL querying skills and in depth DBMS knowledge. o Round 1 : SQL queries, basic DBMS knowledge. o Finals : Hands on writing complex SQL queries, triggers, procedures etc.
Individual event.

string-array.name: hack
string-array.item: Peel off the seven layers and lo, the prize is yours. If domains are your domain, join this contest if you think you can make your own way through this labyrinth. Remember there is no backup and more than some packets may be lost!

Hack Knight promises to put your Linux and Network programming skills to the test of fire which includes shell commands, shell programming and socket programming and networking. o Round 1 : Subjects spanning Linux, networks related commands and questions. o Finals : This round will test your hands-on skills with the shell and networks. Participants will be tested on their skill of shell programming, network programming and Linux concepts.
Maximum 2 members per team.

string-array.name: itr
string-array.item: Just a small circle inside an even smaller loop, can you terminate? Or will you reach your wits end? This is for the code freaks out there, time to play it out! Who said coding isn’t fun? Don’t forget to forget yourself and remember to keep track!

An event to test knowledge on recursion, mathematical skills, coding skills, debugging skills and team work. • Round 1 : Solving recurrences + code optimization + code golfing. • Finals : A hands on, relay coding round. Dynamic programs to be solved using only recursion.
Maximum 2 members in a team.

string-array.name: hackathon
string-array.item: Who cares about order, the usual rules, when you have chaos and confusions? This event is all about that and to see if you don’t succumb to it. And in the mean time, restore the order while at it. As evolution has taught us, explosions always lead to discipline. You know what they say, think out of the box!

Ah, Well, There are No Rules for your freedom. However, You must be original and innovative. NO plagiarism allowed! The development of the application must be started on-site only. You cannot bring partially/fully built things! Your application must be open-source only! The Question statement will be announced on-site. Maximum 2 members in a team.

string-array.name: megaevent
string-array.item:
Click your luck on with an IPAD! Just one condition, you MUST have fun first!
Is the dull routine of life getting to you? Academics drowning you? Feeling like a drone with no fun on sight?
Well, you just got lucky!
Prayatna 2015 brings you the Mega Event, exclusively for you and just you! A big bash created just for fun, festivity and some prizes, yo! Purely non-technical, this event is all about living in the moment. Don’t think, just come! And especially, if you want to win a tab! Unless you were born in the fifteenth century or you are out of your mind, you just should not miss this! Even if you are in the earlier category, you should come anyway because this is a clash of the masses!
An event with various rounds to test your smartness and personality. The rounds are secret and you will be tested impromptu.

string-array.name: eucliddesk
string-array.item: “The laws of nature are but the mathematical thoughts of God. “, Euclid quoted. For all those who breath math and everything is calculations, the desk awaits. Things have turned analytical this year and don’t you miss the chance!

An event to test mathematics, logical reasoning and problem solving skills. o Round 1 : Analytical reasoning + problem solving + puzzle + math logic o Finals : A quiz on advanced Mathematical aptitude and knowledge
Maximum 2 members per team.

string-array.name: pentathlon
string-array.item: An exclusive marathon, not for running, rather to test your knowledge! Questions from Computer Architecture, Operating Systems, Networking, Database Management Systems, and Theory of Computation await. Brace yourselves ‘cause you are about to be hit with missiles of questions. Will you get it or will it get to you? Come compete to find out.

An event to test the strength in all the significant fields of computer science. Hence, witness a Tech All rounder. o Round 1 : Aptitude + Computer Architecture + DBMS + OS + Networks + Theory of Computation o Round 2 : Hands on test on skills in DBMS + Network programming + OS + Microprocessors. o Round 3 : Personal technical interview. .

string-array.name: business
string-array.item: An idea can change the world. But who will listen to yours? That’s where we come in. This event is all about you and is just for you. Come forward with your thoughts and you shall be rewarded. Remember, this shall be your first step to greatness! Time to speak up!

1. Team must strictly contain 3 members. 2. Participants can choose any topic of their choice 3. Submit your abstract on or before March 4th,2015 to trigger.mit@gmail.com 4. The abstract should not exceed one page. 5. The abstract should contain the following: a. A short description about the idea
b. Company overview
c. Industry Analysis
d. Customer Analysis
The teams short-listed for the finals will be intimated by mail about the format of the Onsite Finals.

string-array.name: hunt
string-array.item: Get ready to tread across the ancient epitome of education if you want that gold! We just have one rule for you, hunt or be hunted! Be warned, the trees could be misleading and you might get lost more than once.

A fun event to catch the clues and find the hidden treasure. Teams will be given clues based on which other clues should be found out to discover the final treasure.
Maximum 3 members per team.

string-array.name: cricket
string-array.item: The World Cup is almost upon us! Can India conquer the glory again? But before that, can you conquer the title of “Cricket Freak”? If you are one, then participate in this contest where life is all about the field and howzat!

A quiz to showcase your knowledge about cricket. Prelims: Written round Finals: A quiz master will conduct the quiz for the shortlisted teams
Maximum 2 members per team.

string-array.name: google
string-array.item: Google knows everything, but do you know everything about it? This competition is not about googling the word geek but about the geek of Google that you are. Answer the questions on the ultimate search engine of all time and the honor is yours.

An event to test the facts to know about Google. Prelims: Written round where you should answer various questions about Google. Finals: Round to test how well you use Google search.
Maximum 2 members per team.

string-array.name: gaming
string-array.item: Are you a master of the virtual world? Here is your opportunity to unleash your digital madness and reach the peak of victory. Race to your dreams by going on a spree for free. Our computers are waiting for you!

The registered teams should play and win the computer games given to them. Tell us you are the master! Dota, Counter strike, FIFA, NFS and more!
Maximum 2 members per team.

string-array.name: odebug
string-array.item: To err is to human and to fix them is a genius. This here is a battle for the bug squashers out there! Oh, and the best “compiler” gets an Internship at Zoho! Get your guns ready! We are at war, people!

This is the First round of onsite debugging event. The Round 2 and Finals will be conducted onsite. (Debugging)
An event which tests the \'Tester\' in every programmer. Involves testing, debugging and code fixing for various algorithms and open source application source codes. • Round 1 : An online round testing basics of C/C++ syntax, working, understanding. • Round 2 : Debugging and predicting outputs of difficult code snippets. • Finals : A hands on session, given an improperly working open source application source code, FIX IT ! Maximum 2 members in a team.

string-array.name: olpc
string-array.item: An event to test your skills in algorithms and data structures. Format: A four hour online programming contest in HackerEarth

string-array.name: euler
string-array.item:
For the math maniacs out there!
There are ten fingers and then there are ten numbers. A coincidence? This is a mathematical event for those who work with numbers as if they were their own skin. Come crunch some numbers, if you happen to munch on calculations with a bit of help from google, of course!
An event to test your math skills. Format: Math problems with varying levels of difficulty will be given. Participants unlocking a level will advance to the next level.

string-array.name: loht
string-array.item:
A quest for treasure, for the hero in you!
A noble quest is upon you, you step out on to the road and crush all the traps and then what? A legend is born. Who said greatness comes at an older age and when you have experiences? Look high above these old fables and pursue our riches! May the Gods be with you! We surely are!
Online treasure hunt. Format: Participants should find the correct words for the questions.

string-array.name: bbb
string-array.item: Keep calm and crack the code!

An event to test your cryptography skills. Format: Various questions based on cryptographic methods will be given. Participants unlocking very level with the correct answer will progress to the next level.

string-array.name: onlinecoding
string-array.item: An event to test your skills in algorithms and data structures. Format: A four hour online programming contest in HackerEarth

1) Not a team Event\n\n
2) Online coding (Work from home)!!!

string-array.name: treasurehunt
string-array.item: To err is to human and to fix them is a genius. This here is a battle for the bug squashers out there! Oh, and the best “compiler” gets an Internship at Zoho! Get your guns ready! We are at war, people!

This is the First round of on-site debugging event. The Round 2 and Finals will be conducted on-site. (Debugging)
An event which tests the \'Tester\' in every programmer. Involves testing, debugging and code fixing for various algorithms and open source application source codes. • Round 1 : An online round testing basics of C/C++ syntax, working, understanding. • Round 2 : Debugging and predicting outputs of difficult code snippets. • Finals : A hands on session, given an improperly working open source application source code, FIX IT ! Maximum 2 members in a team.

string-array.name: stops
string-array.item: Next to Neel metal processing unit bus stop

resources.string:
1. The symposium is on September 3rd.

 2. There is no registration fee.


3. Dress code: Strictly adhere to the dress code given below.
 Boys: No T-Shirts or shorts.
 Girls: Salwar with dupatta 

 4. Events commence at 9 am and will close by 2:30 pm.

 5. SVCE College transport can be used and you can check the bus number and routes from the “Transport” tab in the app.
